results.title: Does atenolol improve physical and psychological function after coronary artery bypass surgery: a controlled study.
results.text_hl: Of the @<m>DISEASE_Mental_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001523 @@@psychiatric@@@ and psychological variables, only ratings of Type A behaviour fell significantly in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group (170.9 +/- 5.3 vs 163.0 +/- 5.2; p less than 0.05).

citations.NLM: Bass C, Akhras F, Upward J, Keates J, Lowe D, Harry J, Jackson G. Does atenolol improve physical and psychological function after coronary artery bypass surgery: a controlled study. J Psychosom Res. 1987;31(4):521-9. PMID: 3312591
citations.BibTeX: @article{3312591, title={Does atenolol improve physical and psychological function after coronary artery bypass surgery: a controlled study.}, author={Bass C and Akhras F and Upward J and Keates J and Lowe D and Harry J and Jackson G}, journal={J Psychosom Res}, volume={31}, number={4}, pages={521-9}}

results.title: Atenolol treatment of late luteal phase dysphoric disorder.
results.text_hl: The data indicated significant improvements on the @<m>DISEASE_Mental_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001523 @@@irritability@@@, vigor, elation, and friendliness scores in response to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ compared to placebo.

citations.NLM: Rausch JL, Janowsky DS, Golshan S, Kuhn K, Risch SC. Atenolol treatment of late luteal phase dysphoric disorder. J Affect Disord. 1988 Sep-Oct;15(2):141-7. PMID: 2975684
citations.BibTeX: @article{2975684, title={Atenolol treatment of late luteal phase dysphoric disorder.}, author={Rausch JL and Janowsky DS and Golshan S and Kuhn K and Risch SC}, journal={J Affect Disord}, volume={15}, number={2}, pages={141-7}}

results.title: Nifedipine and atenolol singly and combined for treatment of essential hypertension: comparative multicentre study in general practice in the United Kingdom. Nifedipine-Atenolol Study Review Committee.
results.text_hl: Of 410 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ recruited almost exclusively from general practices in 22 centres in the United Kingdom 210 received @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ and 200 @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@. Both drugs significantly @<m>DISEASE_Mental_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001523 @@@reduced blood@@@ pressure, and control--a reduction of the diastolic pressure to less than 95 mm Hg--was obtained in about 65% of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Nifedipine-Atenolol Study Review Committee. Nifedipine and atenolol singly and combined for treatment of essential hypertension: comparative multicentre study in general practice in the United Kingdom. Nifedipine-Atenolol Study Review Committee. Br Med J (Clin Res Ed). 1988 Feb 13;296(6620):468-72. PMID: 2894883
citations.BibTeX: @article{2894883, title={Nifedipine and atenolol singly and combined for treatment of essential hypertension: comparative multicentre study in general practice in the United Kingdom. Nifedipine-Atenolol Study Review Committee.}, author={Nifedipine-Atenolol Study Review Committee}, journal={Br Med J (Clin Res Ed)}, volume={296}, number={6620}, pages={468-72}}

results.title: Disrupted visceral feedback reduces locomotor activity and influences background contextual fear conditioning in C57BL/6JOlaHsd mice.
results.text_hl: Only the high but not the low dose of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ led to a @<m>DISEASE_Mental_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001523 @@@reduction of locomotor activity@@@ (p<0.02).

citations.NLM: Janitzky K, Linke R, Yilmazer-Hanke DM, Grecksch G, Schwegler H. Disrupted visceral feedback reduces locomotor activity and influences background contextual fear conditioning in C57BL/6JOlaHsd mice. Behav Brain Res. 2007 Aug 22;182(1):109-18. PMID: 17586062
citations.BibTeX: @article{17586062, title={Disrupted visceral feedback reduces locomotor activity and influences background contextual fear conditioning in C57BL/6JOlaHsd mice.}, author={Janitzky K and Linke R and Yilmazer-Hanke DM and Grecksch G and Schwegler H}, journal={Behav Brain Res}, volume={182}, number={1}, pages={109-18}}

results.title: Cognitive impairment associated with beta-blockade in the elderly.
results.text_hl: We report the cases of three elderly @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ presenting with insidious @<m>DISEASE_Mental_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001523 @@@mental impairment@@@ whilst receiving both lipophilic and hydrophilic beta-adrenoceptor blocking agents (@CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ respectively).

citations.NLM: Rogers TK, Bowman CE. Cognitive impairment associated with beta-blockade in the elderly. Postgrad Med J. 1990 Dec;66(782):1050-2. PMID: 2084652
citations.BibTeX: @article{2084652, title={Cognitive impairment associated with beta-blockade in the elderly.}, author={Rogers TK and Bowman CE}, journal={Postgrad Med J}, volume={66}, number={782}, pages={1050-2}}

results.title: Propranolol-induced psychosis.
results.text_hl: A 53-year-old black male with no history of @<m>DISEASE_Mental_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001523 @@@neuropsychiatric behavioral problems@@@ was treated successfully with @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Furosemide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005665 @@@furosemide@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Minoxidil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008914 @@@minoxidil@@@ for previously uncontrolled @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: McGahan DJ, Wojslaw A, Prasad V, Blankenship S. Propranolol-induced psychosis. Drug Intell Clin Pharm. 1984 Jul-Aug;18(7-8):601-3. PMID: 6745087
citations.BibTeX: @article{6745087, title={Propranolol-induced psychosis.}, author={McGahan DJ and Wojslaw A and Prasad V and Blankenship S}, journal={Drug Intell Clin Pharm}, volume={18}, number={7-8}, pages={601-3}}
